Key Match Events: Shaheen Shah Afridi took Pakistan over the line with a couple of sixes in the 19th over
Abbas Afridi failed to clear the fence and got caught in the deep in the 18th over
Imad Wasim fell victim to the Irish onslaught of Pakistani batters in the 12th over
Barry McCarthy got both batsmen out in his third over, putting the brakes on the run chase
Fakhar Zaman tried to go for the big shot as he got caught at mid-off on the first ball of the ninth over
Mohammad Rizwan got caught off his signature shot in the deep after trying it a couple of times
Saim Ayub got beaten for pace as he was caught behind off a leading edge
Mohammad Rizwan and Saim Ayub opened the innings for Pakistan to chase down the 107-run target
Wasim got a wicket with a collision in the deep as Shaheen Shah Afridi holds on to the catch, dismissing Mark Adair in the 14th over
Barry McCarthy follows lead as Wasim clean-bowled him, leaving Ireland 86-7 after 15 overs
Afridi struck again for Pakistan in his second over after being denied an LBW review as Harry Tector fell prey to Afridi's swing and pace
Mohammad Amir took the new ball from the other end and sent Irish skipper Paul Stirling back to the pavilion for getting caught behind
Afridi opened the bowling attack for Pakistan with two wickets in the first over, sending back opener Andrew Balbirnie and one-down Lorcan Tucker
Pre-Game Insights: Pakistan won the toss and decided to bowl first against Ireland in their farewell match of the T20 World Cup 2024
Captain Babar Azam said the decision is based on the ground conditions in Florida where it has not rained today, but the pitch has been under covers for three days
Irish skipper Paul Stirling maintained that he would have liked to bowl first as well and will now look to put up runs on the board
Post-Match Reflections: Shaheen Shah Afridi was declared the Player of the Match for his crucial 13-run addition at the end and his 22-3 in the four overs earlier in the match
Paul Stirling commented, 'Ireland managed to beat Pakistan leading up to the World Cup and did not go on to win the series, but this is a World Cup game and the feeling is different'
Miscellaneous Highlights: Shaheen Shah Afridi given Player of the Match award
Barry McCarthy was the pick of the bowlers for Ireland with his impressive 15-3 figures
